title: Computer Networks
description: Introduction to concepts, principles, and practice of computer communication networks with examples from existing architectures, protocols, and standards with special emphasis on internet protocols. Layering and the OSI model; physical and data link layers; local and wide area networks; datagrams and virtual circuits; routing and congestion control; internetworking. Transport protocols. Students may not receive credit for both CSE 123 and ECE 158A. Prerequisites: CSE 15L or CSE 29 and CSE 101 and CSE 110; restricted to students within the CS25, CS26, EC26, CS27, CS28, and CS29 majors. All other students will be allowed as space permits.
